text: whether you're a seasoned order or a
business executive making presentations
will help you to improve your
presentation skills through planning
preparation and performance this program
helps you developing techniques for
speaking with confidence
choosing audio visual aids and dealing
with questions from an audience
practical advice is given to furnish you
with the confidence you need to handle
real life situations professionally this
program finally gives the self
assessment exercise allowing you to
evaluate and chart your progress
following each presentation you give
this program provides and valuable
information that you will be able to
utilize over and over again as your
presentation skills develop
there are two secrets to making a good
presentation preparation and practice
take the time to prepare properly and
your chances of success will increase
enormously this section of effective
presentation skills covers the following
topics defining your purpose knowing
your audience knowing your venue
searching material writing a
presentation using audio-visual aids
rehashing presentation click on those
topics to browse through the chapters
chapter one defining your purpose before
you start to prepare your presentation
decide what you want to achieve focus on
the purpose of the presentation at every
stage to ensure that your preparation is
relevant and efficient considering your
aims the first points to think about are
what you intend to tell your audience
and how best to communicate your message
your strategy will depend on three
things the type of message you want to
deliver the nature of the audience and
the physical surroundings of the venue
review the purpose of your presentation
and ask yourself whether it is simple
enough or too complex
think about who might be your audience
and how they might receive your
presentation then ask yourself if this
is how you want your presentation to be
received if not modify your purpose
assessing abilities unless you are a
trained actor
it is difficult trying to be anyone
other let yourself concentrate on
defining and utilizing your best assets
for example if you have a good clear
voice use it to your advantage if you
have a talent for such things tell
humorous but relevant short anecdote
next confront your fears and anxieties
about presentation so that you can make
sure that you are prepared for them on
the day of presentation speaking
confidently use techniques that you are
comfortable with in your presentation
this will help you control your nerves
once you are standing in front of the
audience it is quite obvious to get
nervous facing the audience even
successful orders tend to get nervous at
the start of the presentation now let us
understand the common fears one has
while giving a presentation and what can
be the practical solution to those fears
fear number one excessive nerves
you cannot relax you forget when you are
trying to say and you dry up the
solution to handle this fear prepare by
rehearsing in front of a mirror end if
possible at the venue make sure that you
can see your notes clearly at all times
take a deep breath and smile fear number
two bored audience the audience loses
interest and fidget and talk among
themselves this fear can be handled by
ensuring that the point you are trying
to make is relevant if not cut it be
enthusiastic
vary the pace of your presentation and
maintain eye contact with the audience
fear number three hostile audience you
are heckled questions from the floor
aggressive in tone this fear can be
handled by remaining polite and
courteous if your audience has
specialist knowledge of your subject
defer to them read direct difficult
questions back to the audience
fear number four breakdown of visual
aids equipment fails to work or you
cannot remember how to use it to handle
this fear avoid using technology with
which you are not thoroughly familiar
immediately before the presentation
check all the equipment that you will be
using key points to remember while
delivering a presentation your
presentation should be relevant simple
and to the point your audience will be
impressed by the depth and breadth of
your knowledge rather than a show of
faults intellect and wit your positive
attitude energy and enthusiasm for the
subject will speak volumes they will be
remembered by audience long after the
details of your speech have been
forgotten
this was a demo session on making your
presentation more effective from let's
talk a premier language and corporate
training solution company for complete
course on effective presentation skills
visit us at let's talk cogent
